intro: Silene tridentata var. coarctata, commonly known as the narrowleaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and rocky areas. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or semi-arid regions.
